intro: Bubon eriocephalum, commonly known as the woolly sunhemp, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. It is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Bubon eriocephalum is also valued for its use in traditional medicine and as a forage crop.
